author: Roz Zurko
title: Boy kills girl over puppy: Boy, 11, charged with first-degree murder of girl, 8
text:
Play An 11-year-old boy has been charged with first-degree murder in the shooting death of a little girl, his 8-year-old neighbor. The little girl wouldn't show him her puppy and witnesses say he shot her in the chest with his father's shotgun. on.aol.com When an 11-year-old boy asked an 8-year-old girl if he could see her puppy and she told him “no,” witnesses say he shot her in the chest, killing the girl. The 11-year-old boy has been charged with first-degree murder in the killing of McKayla Dyer, who was playing outside in her Tennessee home with her little puppy when she lost her life.
Getty archived image McKayla’s mother, Latasha Dyer, said that her daughter was bullied by this unnamed boy in the past and that she had even called the school over the way this boy was taunting her daughter while in school. She said it had gotten better up until this horrific incident. Dyer said her daughter told the boy “no” and he responded by using his father’s 12-gauge shotgun to shoot her in the chest, reports Fox News on October 6.
The police responded to a call just before 7:30 p.m. on Saturday in White Pine and they found the girl with a gunshot wound to the chest. She was transported via ambulance to the hospital, where she later died. Jefferson County Sheriff G.W. “Bud” McCoig told the media, “It’s a sad situation. It’s always a sad situation with any death. But it hurts when it’s children.”
According to Newser today, the boy and the girl lived next door to each other and the two attended the same school. McKayla was in second grade and the boy was a fifth grade student. The neighbors are stunned over such violence coming from a child of only 11.
At the time the unnamed boy shot the girl, there were five other kids outside with them. None of the other kids were reported injured. McKayla’s mother said this boy bullied her little girl in school, calling her names and just being mean to her. Latasha Dyer said, “I hope the little boy learned his lesson, because he took my baby’s life and I can’t get her back.”
